clinical_study.brief_title: Taste Preferences for Nutritive and Non Nutritive Sweeteners Among Children and Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Taste Preferences for Nutritive and Non Nutritive Sweeteners Among Children and Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to determine whether there are age-, diet- and genetically-related differences in the perception of sweeteners, both nutritive and non-nutritive.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational 3-day study of children between the ages of 7 and 14 and their mothers. A variety of psychophysical methods determined liking for each of the sweeteners and saliva samples were obtained for genotyping of taste receptor genes. Anthropometric and dietary intake measures were also collected.

primary_outcome.measure: Liking for the taste of sweeteners measured via the 3-point facial hedonic scale.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Liking for the taste of sweeteners measured via the 5-point facial hedonic scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Liking for the taste of sweeteners measured via the Monell forced-choice, paired-comparison tracking procedure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Genotyping of taste receptor genes via saliva donation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Genotyping will be completed to measure associations between individual taste receptor genotypes and liking of sweeteners.

secondary_outcome.measure: BMI calculated from body weight and height measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: BMI will be calculated to examine associations between this measure and liking for sweeteners.

secondary_outcome.measure: One day dietary intake collected via the Automated Self-Administered 24-hour dietary recall (ASA24).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary recall will be completed to examine associations between added sugar intake and liking for sweeteners.

arm_group.description: Healthy adults who are the parent of the children

intervention.description: Participants tasted a variety of nutritive and nonnutritive sweeteners

biospec_descr.textblock: Salivary samples obtained for genotyping of taste receptor genes

study_pop.textblock: Healthy children and adults living in the Philadelphia area

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies and taking medication that affected taste
